4.19.17  11:06 pm   what's your biggest goal?
4.19.17  10:46 pm   do you think someday we'll all be truly happy

4.19.17  10:36 pm   what is the longest question you've ever received?

 It couldn't be this one, could it?

  Does this question box have a text limit?

 Is this question too gimmicky?

 Is it unoriginal?

  Are my travels into meta-questions stupid and uncreative?

  Should I find out next time on Dragon Ball Z?

  Do you even care enough to read this?

  Will anyone else even see this?

  Is 1+1 really two

 or is it something stupid a first grader would say, like a window?

  Do you even care? Does anyone else who could potentially see this even care?

 Is reading this question going to prolong your work time, therefore prolonging the release date of HOTEWIG?

 Will you answer with a one-word statement like yes, no, or apparently?

 Should I go beyond the realm of yes or no questions?

 What even defines a question? What is keeping me from just pushing that "Ask" button, and quitting this whole question-making business completely?

  Why should I expect you have the answer to any of these questions?

  Wil l you re ward me for my valiant effort to make a really long question or will you let this burn in the depths of the bottom of unanswered question hell?

  Have many, many other people tried to do this before?

 Am I just an extremely self-evident smart-ass with too much time on my hands?

 Will I make an unnecessary history of japan reference?

 Will you even bother to give this question a green hyperlink? Am I too unsure of myself? Am I too sure of myself?

 Does this rambling tone sound like nails on a chalkboard in your ears?

  Will you link this in with the rest of the questions you don't understand?

  Will asking questions about what you might do prevent you from doing those things?

  Or am I overly forcing tongue-in-cheek humor beyond what it ever should be?

  Does being in on the joke make the joke any better?

  Is this what you imagine the worst possible question could be?

  Am I approaching the text limit?

 If there is no limit, is there a limit to how much of my effort and time I can give in to madly sc rawling these stupid-ass rambling inquiries?

  Do you think this is even vaguely funny?

  Or is the fact that every single sentence is a question make the whole thing sound like some sort of probe or survey?

  Do penguins have ankles?

  How many tangents can I go off of?

  Did these questions even have a focal point at all for tangents to go off of in the first place?

  Is this some sort of protection of my self image?

  Is this whole thing just big questions to myself, revealing the gaping maw that is my self doubt?

  Am I being way too edgy and self-deprecating?

  Is the imagined upward sound that signifies the end of a question getting to you yet?

  Should I care less about how I feel and talk more about you?

 Or have you already figured out that the only thing keeping this decrepit and threadbare series of questions going is self-satire?

  Is it getting old?

  When is/was a good time to stop?

  Has this record already been beaten by some idiot who fell asleep on the a key?

  Are you in any way stran gely hon ored at the dedication of this question?

  Am I retreading ground?

  Will you even read a single word of this or will you just say (or think) "wow, what a long letter"?

  Is my trying too hard the one thing preventing me from making a good question?

  How does one even define "trying too hard"?

  Is that even possible?

 Will you not post this because it won't fit into the webpage?

 Will you format the text so it's really teeny tiny so it does fit the page?

  Do you think it's even worth it to try?

 Would answering my question require you to ignore everyone else's questions?

 Should I care?

  Does it really matter whether or not you answer my question in the grand scheme of things?

  Is that metaphorically zooming out too much?

  Have you noticed that by now, all the random questions have seeped out, because I'm too tired to even care?

  Is this too meta?

  Is it really necessary for me to be asking all these questions?

  How should I possibly expect for you to know any of this?

  Have I just been runnin g around in circles for the last 718 words?

  Are you vaguely impressed that I knew how many words there were or have you just given up reading?

  Does this constitute an essay?

  Would I pass a standardized test with this?

  Can you anagram this block of text?

  Is this snarky at all?

  Have I used the word "or" too much?

  Am I asking questions for no reason or am I just very, very confused?

  Should I end this stupid thing already?

4.19.17  8:05 pm   you ever feel like you're not on the right planet or something?

4.19.17  7:23 pm   So, I've been asking questions for a while, but I want to make this clear. Ever since I watched History of Japan, I've been going through your website like an archaeologist and feel like I know like 80% more about you than everyone else. It also helps me figure out which extremely relevant questions to ask. So what is your view on this?
